name: Platform info
description: Retrieve information about the device and platform the app is running on.

conditions.name: Is on mobile
conditions.description: True if the current device is a mobile device like a phone or tablet. This detection may not always be accurate and does not always imply certain input methods will be used.

conditions.name: On network change
conditions.description: Triggered when the network connection changes, e.g. when moving from Wifi to cellular data.

conditions.name: Is on Windows
conditions.description: True when on a device running Windows.

conditions.name: Is on macOS
conditions.description: True when on a device running macOS / OS X.

conditions.name: Is on Linux
conditions.description: True when on a device running Linux.

conditions.name: Is on Chrome OS
conditions.description: True when on a device running Chrome OS.

conditions.name: Is on Android
conditions.description: True when on a device running Android.

conditions.name: Is on iOS
conditions.description: True when on a device running iOS.

conditions.name: Is web export
conditions.description: True when running after a web-based export. Also true in preview mode.

conditions.name: Is Cordova export
conditions.description: True when running after a Cordova-based export (Android/iOS).

conditions.name: On wake lock acquired
conditions.description: Triggered after 'Request wake lock' if the lock was successfully acquired.

conditions.name: On wake lock error
conditions.description: Triggered after 'Request wake lock' if a lock failed to be acquired.

conditions.name: On wake lock released
conditions.description: Triggered when an active wake lock is released. Note in some cases this may be done automatically.

conditions.name: Is wake lock active
conditions.description: True if a wake lock has been successfully acquired and has not yet been released.

conditions.name: Is wake lock supported
conditions.description: True if the 'Request wake lock' action is supported and can be used.

conditions.name: Is Windows wrapper export
conditions.description: True when running after a Windows wrapper (WebView2) export.

conditions.name: Is macOS wrapper export
conditions.description: True when running after a macOS wrapper (WKWebView) export.

conditions.name: Is Linux wrapper export
conditions.description: True when running after a Linux wrapper (CEF) export.

actions.name: Request wake lock
actions.description: Request a wake lock to keep the screen on permanently. Note this increases power usage so will drain battery faster.

actions.name: Release wake lock
actions.description: Release any active wake lock so the screen can turn off to save power again.

expressions.name: Renderer
expressions.description: The graphics rendering technology in use, e.g. "webgl2".

expressions.name: RendererDetail
expressions.description: A string describing the graphics hardware, if available.

expressions.name: DevicePixelRatio
expressions.description: The number of device (hardware) pixels per CSS pixel.

expressions.name: ScreenWidth
expressions.description: The width of the screen in pixels.

expressions.name: ScreenHeight
expressions.description: The height of the screen in pixels.

expressions.name: WindowInnerWidth
expressions.description: The width of the window client area in pixels.

expressions.name: WindowInnerHeight
expressions.description: The height of the window client area in pixels.

expressions.name: WindowOuterWidth
expressions.description: The width of the entire window area in pixels.

expressions.name: WindowOuterHeight
expressions.description: The height of the entire window area in pixels.

expressions.name: Downlink
expressions.description: An estimated effective bandwidth measurement in megabits per second.

expressions.name: DownlinkMax
expressions.description: The maximum downlink speed in megabits per second of the underlying connection technology.

expressions.name: ConnectionType
expressions.description: The type of connection technology in use, e.g. "cellular", "wifi" or "ethernet".

expressions.name: ConnectionEffectiveType
expressions.description: A connection rating compared to cellular data connections, e.g. "2g", "3g", "4g".

expressions.name: ConnectionRTT
expressions.description: The estimated effective round-trip time (latency) of the connection, in milliseconds.

expressions.name: HardwareConcurrency
expressions.description: The number of hardware threads supported by the device CPU. 0 if cannot detect.

expressions.name: DeviceMemory
expressions.description: The approximate amount of device memory in gigabytes. 0 if cannot detect.

expressions.name: CanvasCssWidth
expressions.description: The width of the main display canvas in CSS pixels.

expressions.name: CanvasCssHeight
expressions.description: The height of the main display canvas in CSS pixels.

expressions.name: CanvasDeviceWidth
expressions.description: The width of the main display canvas in device pixels.

expressions.name: CanvasDeviceHeight
expressions.description: The height of the main display canvas in device pixels.

expressions.name: SafeAreaInsetTop
expressions.description: Inset in CSS pixels of safe rectangular area on non-rectangular screens.

expressions.name: SafeAreaInsetRight
expressions.description: Inset in CSS pixels of safe rectangular area on non-rectangular screens.

expressions.name: SafeAreaInsetBottom
expressions.description: Inset in CSS pixels of safe rectangular area on non-rectangular screens.

expressions.name: SafeAreaInsetLeft
expressions.description: Inset in CSS pixels of safe rectangular area on non-rectangular screens.

expressions.name: FramesPerSecond
expressions.description: Number of frames rendered per second.

expressions.name: TicksPerSecond
expressions.description: Number of ticks processed per second.
